As an AI language model, I do not have personal preferences. However, here are a few popular hiking trails in the Charlottesville area:

1. Humpback Rocks: This is a challenging but rewarding hike in the Blue Ridge Mountains. The trail is just over two miles and gains over 800 feet in elevation, but it offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape. 2. Saunders-Monticello Trail: This is a popular trail that winds through the forests and fields of the Monticello estate. The trail is relatively flat and easy, and offers beautiful views of the Blue Ridge Mountains. 3. Rivanna Trail: This is a 20-mile trail that loops around Charlottesville, passing through forests, parks, and neighborhoods. Portions of the trail are hilly, but many sections are flat and easy to navigate. 4. Crabtree Falls: Located a little over an hour from Charlottesville in Nelson County, Crabtree Falls is a popular hiking destination with a series of cascading waterfalls. The hike is approximately 2.5 miles round trip and can be steep in some areas, but is well-worth the effort. These are just a few of the many great hiking trails in the Charlottesville area. Be sure to check weather reports and trail conditions before you go, and be prepared with water, snacks, and appropriate footwear.
